channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: What's on your TikTok page? U.S. looks to scour tourists' online profiles
item.description: Foreign visitors who are eligible to bypass the visa application process may soon have to turn over five years' worth of social media history to enter the U.S., under a new Trump administration plan.
item.content:encoded:
Foreign visitors who are eligible to bypass the visa application process may soon have to turn over five years' worth of social media history to enter the U.S., under a new Trump administration plan.

(Image credit: Julie Jacobson)
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Romo

item.title: Trump is trying to preempt state AI laws via an executive order. It may not be legal
item.description: The executive order is the latest in a series of attempts by the Trump administration to hold back state-level AI rules. But many Republicans are also uncomfortable with the effort.
item.content:encoded:
The executive order is the latest in a series of attempts by the Trump administration to hold back state-level AI rules. But many Republicans are also uncomfortable with the effort.

(Image credit: Alex Wroblewski)
item.dc:creator: Huo Jingnan

item.title: You know what's definitely not a 'hoax'? Our news quiz. Give it a go
item.description: What did Disney do now? Which beloved icons are having birthdays? Why is there a question about hair?
item.content:encoded: What did Disney do now? Which beloved icons are having birthdays? Why is there a question about hair?
item.dc:creator: Holly J. Morris

item.title: In a setback for Trump, Indiana lawmakers defeat redistricting plan
item.description: Indiana Republicans resisted the call by President Trump for redistricting. He and the state's Republican governor threatened to back primary challenges against senators who wouldn't get on board.
item.content:encoded:
Indiana Republicans resisted the call by President Trump for redistricting. He and the state's Republican governor threatened to back primary challenges against senators who wouldn't get on board.

(Image credit: Zach Bundy)
item.dc:creator: Ben Thorp

item.title: Head Start centers told to avoid 'disability,' 'women' and more in funding requests
item.description: New court documents reveal a list of nearly 200 words or phrases the Trump administration told Head Start programs it does not want to see in their funding requests.
item.content:encoded:
New court documents reveal a list of nearly 200 words or phrases the Trump administration told Head Start programs it does not want to see in their funding requests.

(Image credit: Rebecca Blackwell)
item.dc:creator: Cory Turner

item.title: Forget flowers: These ancient plants attract pollinators by getting hot
item.description: While many modern plants use colorful flowers to attract pollinators, ancient palm-like plants called cycads lure them by heating up and glowing in the infrared.
item.content:encoded:
While many modern plants use colorful flowers to attract pollinators, ancient palm-like plants called cycads lure them by heating up and glowing in the infrared.

(Image credit: Michael Calonje)
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce

item.title: Billion-dollar OpenAI deal allows users to make content with Disney characters
item.description: It's a whole new world for Mickey, Simba, Stitch and more as Disney brings hundreds of its characters to Sora, the short-form video platform from OpenAI, as part of a three-year licensing agreement.
item.content:encoded:
It's a whole new world for Mickey, Simba, Stitch and more as Disney brings hundreds of its characters to Sora, the short-form video platform from OpenAI, as part of a three-year licensing agreement.

(Image credit: Disney)
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong

item.title: The State Department reinstates an old font, in a typeface about-face
item.description: The State Department is swapping out Calibri for Times New Roman in all its official documents, reversing a Biden-era change that aimed to increase accessibility for readers with disabilities.
item.content:encoded:
The State Department is swapping out Calibri for Times New Roman in all its official documents, reversing a Biden-era change that aimed to increase accessibility for readers with disabilities.

(Image credit: Allison Robbert)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: U.S. and Japan flex military muscles in a show of force amid Tokyo's feud with Beijing
item.description: This follows joint drills by Chinese and Russian strategic bombers and fighters on Tuesday that prompted Japan and South Korea to scramble planes to monitor them.
item.content:encoded:
This follows joint drills by Chinese and Russian strategic bombers and fighters on Tuesday that prompted Japan and South Korea to scramble planes to monitor them.

(Image credit: Japan's Ministry of Defense)
item.dc:creator: Anthony Kuhn

item.title: Farmers welcome Trump's $12 billion aid package, say additional relief is needed
item.description: President Trump says he's sending $12 billion in aid to American farmers who are reeling from global trade disruptions. Those include inflation and Trump's tariffs that are making fertilizer and farm equipment more expensive, and the President's trade war with China which closed a huge market for American soybean exports.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump says he's sending $12 billion in aid to American farmers who are reeling from global trade disruptions. Those include inflation and Trump's tariffs that are making fertilizer and farm equipment more expensive, and the President's trade war with China which closed a huge market for American soybean exports. 

(Image credit: Kirk Siegler)
item.dc:creator: Kirk Siegler
